Method Detail

isError

public boolean isError()
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Does this value hold an error? If this value is a list then each member of the list is checked for errors and true is returned if any error is found.

Specified by:
isError in class AbstractPortValue
Returns:
true if there is an error in this value, false otherwise.

get

public AbstractPortValue get(int index)
Get the data value at the specified index. As PortData only ever holds a single data point specifying an index greater than zero makes no sense. This method is included for completeness and to satisfy the List interface.

Specified by:
get in interface java.util.List<AbstractPortValue>
Specified by:
get in class java.util.AbstractList<AbstractPortValue>
Parameters:
index - the index of the data value to return.
Returns:
the data value at the specified index.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if anything other than zero is given as the value for index.

size

public int size()
Get the number of data values in this list. This method just returns 1 as PortData only ever holds a single data item. This method is included for completeness and to satisfy the List interface.

Specified by:
size in interface java.util.Collection<AbstractPortValue>
Specified by:
size in interface java.util.List<AbstractPortValue>
Specified by:
size in class java.util.AbstractCollection<AbstractPortValue>
Returns:
1.

getDataSize

public long getDataSize()
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Get the size, in bytes, of the data held by this value. For lists this is the total of all the data sizes in the list.

Specified by:
getDataSize in class AbstractPortValue
Returns:
the total size of the data in this value in bytes.

getDataStream

public java.io.InputStream getDataStream()
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Get an input stream that can be used to stream the data held by this value from the server. Note: You are responsible for closing the stream once you have finished with it. Not doing so may prevent further use of the underlying network connection.

Specified by:
getDataStream in class AbstractPortValue
Returns:
the stream to read the data from.
See Also:
AbstractPortValue.getData(), AbstractPortValue.getData(int), AbstractPortValue.getDataAsString()

                     throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Get all data held in this port value and save it to the specified file.

Specified by:
writeDataToFile in class AbstractPortValue
Parameters:
file - the file to write the data to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the specified file cannot be found, opened or written to for any reason.

getData

public byte[] getData()
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Get all the data held in this port value. This method can only be used on subclasses that actually hold data, such as PortDataValue or PortErrorValue.

Specified by:
getData in class AbstractPortValue
Returns:
all the data held in this port value.
See Also:
AbstractPortValue.getData(int), AbstractPortValue.getDataStream(), AbstractPortValue.getDataAsString()

getData

public byte[] getData(int index)
Description copied from class: AbstractPortValue
Get all the data held at the specified index of this output value. If this value is a PortListValue then the value at the specified index is returned. If this value is a PortDataValue then only index 0 will return any data.

Specified by:
getData in class AbstractPortValue
Parameters:
index - the index of the data to return.
Returns:
the data at the specified index.
See Also:
AbstractPortValue.getData(), AbstractPortValue.getDataStream(), AbstractPortValue.getDataAsString()

                      int length)
